sorcer.service
Interface AsyncExertion

All Superinterfaces:
Evaluation<Object>, Exertion, Identifiable, Invocation<Object>, Serializable, Service
public interface AsyncExertion
extends Exertion

An asynchronus exertion is a service-oriented indirect message with an enclosed service Context and a collection of service Signatures. It is structured the same way as the Exertion but is is invoked asynchronousely.

Author:
Mike Sobolewski
See Also:
Exertion

Method Detail

request

Exertion request(Transaction txn)
                 throws TransactionException,
                        InterruptedException,
                        ExertionException
Gives this exerion asynchronously to its assigned provider for to a dynamically bound Service matching its Operator.Type signature. If a service provider is not set, then this exertion finds dynamically any availale service provider matching its process signature for its asynchronous execution.

Parameters:
txn - the transaction (if any) under which to exert
Returns:
a resulting exertion
Throws:
TransactionException - if a transaction error occurs
InterruptedException - if the thread in which the asynchrounues exertion invocation occurs is interrupted
ExertionException - is an exertion invocation failed for any reason
See Also:
Exertion.exert(net.jini.core.transaction.Transaction, sorcer.service.Parameter...), Exertion#setServicer

Exertion getRequestResult(RequestId id)
